title: Havana, a ghost town battered by shortages and US threats
subhed: 'Cuba, an island adrift' (1/3) In the small socialist country, US pressure for regime change has reached its peak since the kidnapping of Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro on January 3. Daily life has become a nightmare, and public discourse is more closely monitored than ever.

title: Trump battles Minneapolis shooting fallout as agents put on leave
Springsteen dedicates fiery ode to the people of Minneapolis
Escaped Syrian detainees recount chaos after Kurdish forces withdraw
subhed: The security handover of prisons and detention camps from the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) to the authorities in Damascus took place amid total confusion, allowing several dozen prisoners to escape. Each side has blamed the other for the incident.
byline: By Hélène Sallon (Deir Ezzor province (Syria), special correspondent)

title: John Bolton: 'Toppling the Iranian regime is the most effective way to remove the terrorist threat the West has faced'
subhed: The former US national security adviser argues, in an op-ed for Le Monde, that the EU stands out for its passivity in the face of the Islamic Republic, while that dictatorship carries out assassinations of dissidents in Europe, supports international terrorism and poses a nuclear threat.

title: 'For sure': Two impromptu words by Macron go viral
subhed: During his speech at the World Economic Forum in Davos, the French president delivered a common English phrase – in a strong accent – that achieved global fame.

title: Charles Kushner, Trump's man in Paris
subhed: The 71-year-old US ambassador, who took up his post in May 2025, is the father of Jared Kushner, Donald Trump's son-in-law and envoy to the Middle East. Like his son, he is known for his unorthodox methods and does not hesitate to interfere in France's domestic affairs.

title: White House and Slovak PM deny report on Trump's mental state
France backs EU move to label Iran's Revolutionary Guards a terrorist group
Plane crashes near Colombia and Venezuela border, killing 15
France is still trading uranium with Russia, nearly four years after Ukraine invasion
byline: By Perrine Mouterde and Adrien Pécout

title: French finance minister urges Capgemini explain its contract with ICE
French senators reject assisted dying bill, send it back to lower house
Greenland threat is a 'strategic wake-up call for all of Europe,' says Macron
French Parliament's lessons from a monthslong budget battle
Half of new immigrants in France are students or refugees
Le Pen's appeal trial: Far-right ex-assistants struggle to justify their jobs
Paris Haute Couture Week: Chanel dazzles, Armani faces new challenge
byline: By Elvire von Bardeleben and Valentin Pérez

title: Veteran civil servant Xavier Piechaczyk to head Paris public transports
Work-related cancers remain a blind spot in France's public health system
subhed: A study conducted by doctors and occupational sociologists at the Avignon Hospital Center on over 500 lymphoma patients found there was a 'massive underestimation' of work-related cancers in France.
byline: By Stéphane Foucart (Avignon, southern France, special correspondent)

title: How India and the EU created a common market to counter Trump
subhed: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and representatives of the European Union concluded a trade agreement on January 27, after nearly 20 years of intermittent negotiations, opening up a market of nearly two billion people.
byline: By Carole Dieterich (New Delhi (India) correspondent) and Virginie Malingre (Brussels, Europe bureau)

title: 2026 FIFA World Cup: Calls for boycott emerge to bring Trump 'to his senses'
subhed: The US president's desire to claim Greenland has prompted political figures to raise the possibility of national football teams withdrawing.

title: A pragmatic trade agreement between India and the EU
Europe: 'A new social federalism must be invented as the response of democratic states to empires'
The EU's emancipation from the US requires clarity and resolve
